com.viaoa.util
Class OAXMLWriter

java.lang.Object
  com.viaoa.util.OAXMLWriter

public class OAXMLWriter
extends java.lang.Object

OAXMLWriter creates an XML file that can then be read using an OAXMLReader.
If an object has already been stored in the file, then its key will be stored.

See Also:
OAXMLReader

shouldWriteProperty

public int shouldWriteProperty(java.lang.Object obj,
                               java.lang.String propertyName,
                               java.lang.Object value)
called by OAObject.write to know if object should be written for a property that references another OAObject. This can be overwritten to control which properties are saved. default = WRITE_YES;

setEncodeMessage

public void setEncodeMessage(java.lang.String msg)
Used to encrypt all data.

NOTE: currently only works with printCDATA. This needs to be changed so that all printXX methods encrypt data.

See Also:
OAXMLReader.setDecodeMessage(java.lang.String)

convertToString

public java.lang.String convertToString(java.lang.String property,
                                        java.lang.Object value)
Method that can be overwritten to provide custom conversion to String. Called to convert a value to a String when there does not exist an OAConverter for a class.

Returns:
null to skip property.
